GET /accounts/{account_id}/access/organi.description: Returns the configuration for your Zero Trust organization.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

allow_authenticate_via_warp.description: When set to true, users can authenticate via WARP for any application in your organization. Application settings will take precedence over this value.

auth_domain.description: The unique subdomain assigned to your Zero Trust organization.

auto_redirect_to_identity.description: When set to `true`, users skip the identity provider selection step during login.

forbidden.description: The uid of the custom page to use when a user is denied access after failing a non-identity rule.

identity_denied.description: The uid of the custom page to use when a user is denied access.

is_ui_read_only.description: Lock all settings as Read-Only in the Dashboard, regardless of user permission. Updates may only be made via the API or Terraform for this account when enabled.

background_color.description: The background color on your login page.

footer_text.description: The text at the bottom of your login page.

header_text.description: The text at the top of your login page.

logo_path.description: The URL of the logo on your login page.

text_color.description: The text color on your login page.

name.description: The name of your Zero Trust organization.

session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for applications will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h.

ui_read_only_toggle_reason.description: A description of the reason why the UI read only field is being toggled.
ui_read_only_toggle_reason.example: Temporarily turn off the UI read only lock to make a change via the UI

user_seat_expiration_inactive_time.description: The amount of time a user seat is inactive before it expires. When the user seat exceeds the set time of inactivity, the user is removed as an active seat and no longer counts against your Teams seat count.  Minimum value for this setting is 1 month (730h). Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: `ns`, `us` (or `µs`), `ms`, `s`, `m`, `h`.

warp_auth_session_duration.description: The amount of time that tokens issued for applications will be valid. Must be in the format `30m` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: m, h.

200.description: Get your Zero Trust organization response

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

4XX.description: Get your Zero Trust organization response failure

x-api-token-group: Access: Organizations, Identity Providers, and Groups Revoke
Access: Organizations, Identity Providers, and Groups Write
Access: Organizations, Identity Providers, and Groups Read

GET /accounts/{account_id}/access/organi.description: Returns the DoH settings for your Zero Trust organization.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

client_id.description: The Client ID for the service token. Access will check for this value in the `CF-Access-Client-ID` request header.

duration.description: The duration for how long the service token will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h. The default is 1 year in hours (8760h).

allOf.description: The ID of the service token.

name.description: The name of the service token.

doh_jwt_duration.description: The duration the DoH JWT is valid for. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h.  Note that the maximum duration for this setting is the same as the key rotation period on the account.

200.description: Get your Zero Trust organization DoH settings response

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

4XX.description: Get your Zero Trust organization DoH settings response failure

GET /accounts/{account_id}/access/organi.summary: Get your Zero Trust organization DoH settings

POST /accounts/{account_id}/access/organ.description: Revokes a user's access across all applications.

parameters.description: When set to `true`, all devices associated with the user will be revoked.
parameters.name: devices

devices.description: When set to `true`, all devices associated with the user will be revoked.

email.description: The email of the user to revoke.

user_uid.description: The uuid of the user to revoke.

warp_session_reauth.description: When set to `true`, the user will be required to re-authenticate to WARP for all Gateway policies that enforce a WARP client session duration. When `false`, the user’s WARP session will remain active

200.description: Revoke all Access tokens for a user response

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

4xx.description: Revoke all Access tokens for a user response failure

POST /accounts/{account_id}/access/organ.summary: Revoke all Access tokens for a user
x-api-token-group: Access: Organizations, Identity Providers, and Groups Write

PUT /accounts/{account_id}/access/organi.description: Updates the DoH settings for your Zero Trust organization.

doh_jwt_duration.description: The duration the DoH JWT is valid for. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h.  Note that the maximum duration for this setting is the same as the key rotation period on the account. Default expiration is 24h

service_token_id.description: The uuid of the service token you want to use for DoH authentication

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

client_id.description: The Client ID for the service token. Access will check for this value in the `CF-Access-Client-ID` request header.

duration.description: The duration for how long the service token will be valid. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h. The default is 1 year in hours (8760h).

allOf.description: The ID of the service token.

name.description: The name of the service token.

doh_jwt_duration.description: The duration the DoH JWT is valid for. Must be in the format `300ms` or `2h45m`. Valid time units are: ns, us (or µs), ms, s, m, h.  Note that the maximum duration for this setting is the same as the key rotation period on the account. Default expiration is 24h
